topic.title: Typography
topic.shortdesc: Documentation and examples for Bootstrap typography, including global settings, headings, body text, lists, and more.

section.title: Headings
section.p: All HTML headings, h1 through h6, are available. outputclass="h1" through outputclass="h6" are also available, for when you want to match the font styling of a heading but cannot use the associated HTML element.

body.codeblock: <title outputclass="h1">h1. Bootstrap heading</title> <title outputclass="h2">h2. Bootstrap heading</title> <title outputclass="h3">h3. Bootstrap heading</title> <title outputclass="h4">h4. Bootstrap heading</title> <title outputclass="h5">h5. Bootstrap heading</title> <title outputclass="h6">h6. Bootstrap heading</title>

section.title: Customizing headings
section.p: Annotate a ph with an outputclass to recreate the small secondary heading text from Bootstrap 3.

bodydiv.p: Fancy display heading with faded secondary text

body.codeblock: <title>Fancy display heading <ph outputclass="small text-body-secondary">with faded secondary text</ph></title>

section.title: Display headings
section.p: Traditional heading elements are designed to work best in the meat of your page content. When you need a heading to stand out, consider using a display heading — a larger, slightly more opinionated heading style.

body.codeblock: <title outputclass="display-1">Display 1</title> <title outputclass="display-2">Display 2</title> <title outputclass="display-3">Display 3</title> <title outputclass="display-4">Display 4</title> <title outputclass="display-5">Display 5</title> <title outputclass="display-6">Display 6</title>

section.title: Lead
section.p: Make a paragraph stand out by adding outputclass="lead" — this is automatically added to shortdesc elements.

section.title: Text utilities
section.p: Change text alignment, transform, style, weight, line-height, decoration and color with Bootstrap's text and color utilities.

section.title: Abbreviations
section.p: Stylized implementation of HTML’s abbr element for abbreviations and acronyms to show the expanded version on hover. Abbreviations have a default underline and gain a help cursor to provide additional context on hover and to users of assistive technologies.
Add outputclass="initialism" to an abbreviation for a slightly smaller font-size.

section.title: Blockquotes
section.p: For quoting blocks of content from another source within your document, use the DITA lq element, it is styled automatically.

lq.p: A well-known quote, contained in a blockquote element.

body.codeblock: A well-known quote, contained in a blockquote element.

section.title: Naming a source
section.p: The HTML spec requires that blockquote attribution be placed outside the rendered HTML blockquote element. When providing attribution, wrap your the DITA lq in a fig and add a title to the fig. Be sure to wrap the name of the source work in the cite as well.

section.title: Unstyled
section.p: Remove the default list-style and left margin on list items (immediate children only). This only applies to immediate children list items, meaning you will need to add the outputclass="list-unstyled" for any nested lists as well.

ul.li: However, this style only applies to immediate child elements.

Nested lists:
are unaffected by this style
will still show a bullet
and have appropriate left margin
This may still come in handy in some situations.

section.title: Description list alignment
section.p: Terms and descriptions align horizontally using Bootstrap's grid system of predefined classes. For longer terms, text is truncated with an ellipsis.
